file_content.text: You're something else, the way you handled those Skel. Thanks again.
Wait, you made it out of there alive? And you got the parts?
Of course you did. You're Sith. What was I thinking? Nothing stands a chance against a Sith.
Not that I didn't think you could do it, but I wasn't going to bet against those creatures after seeing what they did to my crew.
Thank you. I'll get the shuttle running and get these parts to the outpost as quick as possible.
Bring back the engine parts, and kill a few Skel for me and my crew.
Hey, hunter. Can you lend a fellow freelancer a hand?
Ack. Sith! I mean, my lord! Please don't kill me! Please don't kill me! I need your help.
Please, don't kill me! I work for the Empire! Don't kill me!
Me and my crew were running engine parts for the Imperials when these things attacked. Hairy, long-nosed monsters. Skel, I think they're called.
I'm the only one who survived. Everyone else got torn to pieces.
You'd better have a good reason for stopping a Sith.
What's this got to do with me?
No disrespect, but I need a favor.
Don't worry. The Empire will not make the mistake of hiring you again.
Worthless weaklings.
I don't mind at all if it keeps me out of situations like this. We threw everything we had at those things!
Sorry to hear about your people. Want to pay me to go bust up some Skel?
I'd be mad if I lost my crew.
Crew's dead. Nothing's bringing them back.
The dangers were part of the job. If you weren't ready for them, you shouldn't have accepted.
You should prepare better.
No one's ever ready to die. But my crew was pouring blaster fire into those things, and they just wouldn't go down.
Why should I care?
That's awful.
The Skel ran off with the engine parts my crew and I were taking to the Imperial outpost.
I was paid to deliver those parts, and I don't like taking pay if I don't do the job. Course, I'm in no shape to attack the Skel.
You look like you might actually be able to handle those things. Bring back the engine parts. I'll give you my pay, minus expenses, if that matters.
I love risking my life.
Sounds good.
Thanks. The Skel are hiding out in those caves. You get me those engine parts, and I'll see that they get to the outpost.
I'll pass. [Refuse quest]
Well, thanks for your time. I hate to inconvenience anyone.
I'll be happy if I never have to see this planet again.
Heard you made the delivery. Hope you made those Talz bleed for me and my crew.
The Empire needs those power converters; there's good money in seeing them delivered.
Me and my crew were running power converters for the Imperials when these things attacked. Hairy, four-eyed monsters. Talz, I think they're called.
Why not cut your losses?
I was paid to deliver those parts, and I don't like taking pay if I don't do the job. Bad for future business.
Not just my problem anymore.
The Empire needs power converters to keep its outposts running, but anybody who comes close to my shipment gets picked off by the Talz.
You look like you might actually be able to handle those things. Finish that delivery for me, and my partner'll give you my pay--minus expenses, if that matters.
Here's where those monsters got the drop on us. Recover the power converters, and Dar will have your credits waiting.
If you're feeling charitable, well, just make those freaks pay for me and my crew, all right?
